add.description: Add a to b giving c

ADD.description: Add a to b giving c

body: by value args as string occurs any.

multiply.description: Multiply a by y giving z

MULTIPLY.description: MULTIPLY a BY y GIVING z

body: procedure division using by value val as ${3:binary-long}.

subtract.description: subtract a from b giving c

SUBTRACT.description: SUBTRACT a FROM b GIVING c

function-acos.description: function trigonometric arc-cosine, or inverse cosine, of cosine

function-asin.description: function trigonometric arc-sine, or inverse sine, of sine

function-atan.description: function trigonometric arc-tangent, or inverse tangent, of tangent

function-bit-of.description: function to convert the argument to bits

function-bit-to-char.description: function to convert bits to character

function-char.description: function character in the ordinal position specified by integer, from the current alphanumeric collating sequence

function-currency-symbol.description: function currency symbol character currently in effect for the locale under which the program is running

function-current-date.description: function current date and time as 21-character value

function-date-of-integer.description: function to convert the integer date to standard date format

function-date-to-yyyymmdd.description: function to convert a date with a 2 digit year to a 4 digit year

function-day-of-integer.description: function to convert the integer date to number of days in the gregorian calendar

function-day-to-yyyyddd.description: function to convert a date with a 2 digit year to a 4 digit year

function-display-of.description: function to convert an alphanumeric string using a codepage

function-exp.description: function to return e raised to the power of the argument

function-exp10.description: function to return 10 raised to the power of the argument

function-factorial.description: function to return the factorial of the argument

function-hex-of.description: function to return hexadecimal representation of the argument

function-hex-to-char.description: function to return a character string that is a hexadecimal representation of the argument

function-integer.description: greatest integer value that is less than or equal to number

function-integer-of-date.description: converts yyyymmdd to an internal integer-date

function-integer-of-day.description: converts yyyymmdd to an internal integer-day

function-integer-part.description: portion of number that occurs to the left of the decimal point

function-length.description: returns the length (in character positions) of the specified item

function-log.description: format base e logarithm of number

function-lowercase.description: character string that contains string with any uppercase letters replaced by their corresponding lowercase letters

function-max.description: Alphanumeric/Index/Integer/National/Numeric maximum value from the specified list of numbers

function-mean.description: statistical mean value of the specified list of numbers

function-median.description: statistical median value of the specified list of numbers

function-midrange.description: statistical midrange value of the specified list of numbers

function-min.description: statistical min value of the specified list of numbers

function-mod.description: remainder from the division of value by modulus

function-national-of.description: convert alphanumeric-string to the national coded character set representation

function-numval-c.description: corresponding numeric value for string, case-sensitive if ANYCASE not given

function-ord.description: ordinal position in the program character set corresponding to char

function-ord-max.description: max. ordinal position in the program character set corresponding to list of chars

function-ord-min.description: min. ordinal position in the program character set corresponding to list of chars

function-present-value.description: approximation of the present value of a series of future period-end amount

function-random.description: pseudo-random number 0> <1 from a rectangular distribution with optional seed

function-range.description: value of the maximum argument minus the value of the minimum argument

function-rem.description: remainder of number divided by divisor

function-reverse.description: reverse representation with same length of string

function-sin.description: trigonometric sine of the specified angle

function-standard-deviation.description: function to return the standard deviation of its arguments

function-sqrt.description: aproximation of the square root of number

function-sum.description: function to return the sum of its arguments

function-tan.description: trigonometric tangent of the specified angle

function-test-numval.description: function to verify the contents of the argument

function-test-numval-f.description: function to verify the contents of the argument

function-trim.description: function to trim leading and or trailing spaces of the argument

function-ulength.description: function to return the number of UTF8 or UTF16 characters of the argument

function-upos.description: function to return an integer value equal to the position of the nth item in the passed UTF8 or UTF16 argument

function-upper-case.description: function to return the argument in upper case

function-usubstr.description: function to return substring of the character data passed that contains UTF8 or UTF16 data

function-usupplementary.description: function to return an integer value equating to the index of the first unicode character of the argument

function-uvalid.description: function to return an integer value equating to the index of the first invalid unicode character of the argument

function-uwidth.description: function to return an integer value equal to the width in bytes of the nth item in the passed UTF8 or UTF16 argument

function-variance.description: statistical variance of the specified list of number argument

function-year-to-yyyy.description: convert yy to yyyy with optional yy-cutoff to delineate centuries

body: WRITE REPORT ${1:report-name} FROM ${2:layout} TO {3:layout2} LENGTH {4:length} AFTER {3:id}.
